splashposts.headline: Pandemic causes service disruption
splashposts.description: A global pandemic has had significant impact across all divisions with staff having to work from home. Whilst this is quite normal for certain areas such as consulting roles; this has been particularly problematic for our call centere operations and certain technical roles. Operations are continuing to run in a relatively reduced capacity. We are currently taking into considerations the security concerns ragarding this sudden shift to working form home.

splashposts.headline: Plum Ltd expanding overseas
splashposts.description: In order to incrase our Managed Services aquisition to reach out to new clients, as well as provided longer operational support hours. Plum Ltd. are looking to expand their business by founding new Managed Services departments in Australia and the United States. Whilst broadening our market the main intentions of this expansion is to move toward providing 24/7 custom and support.

subsiduaries.description: This is a specialist company that serves the defence sector.  The defence services business has its own specialist network and systems and security programme given the sensitivity of its work.  The Defence services arm is a List X UK Government contractor.  The defence services company has approximately 1000 staff in the UK.  This company provides security consulting and managed services to defence organisations alongside the development, implementation and maintenance of specialist applications and communications systems and networks.

callsToAction.text: click here to find out more

subsiduaries.description: The managed services arm focuses on the provision of managed security services (e.g. SOC, vulnerability assessments, audits etc.), network monitoring and engineering alongside services such as helpdesk outsourcing.  This arm of the business is the largest with 3,000 employees.  Many of the standard managed service offerings (1st, 2nd line) are delivered by a sub-contracted third party based in India although specialist services are delivered locally as are cases for government clients. Plum is looking to open sub offices in the US and Australia to ensure a 24 hours a day specialist service. Customer support services are based within managed services.

callsToAction.text: click here to find out more

subsiduaries.description: The Systems Engineering and Integration organisation focuses on the design, build and implementation of tailor made solutions for clients globally in multiple sectors.  This organisation works closely with Plum Software, often deploying tailor made or Plum solutions into client organisations.  Services offered by this organisation range from the installation and maintenance of hardware to software, to the management of services from cloud providers and third party partners.  This organisation also has a specialised team with knowledge of ICSs that could ultimately serve the global market in this area. The linux engineers and systems administrators are largely based in this entity.

callsToAction.text: click here to find out more

subsiduaries.description: Plum Software develops both off the shelf products including productivity tools such as Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Document Management software which are often sold and deployed by the Systems Engineering and Integration Team.  In addition to this Plum Software develops bespoke applications for clients with support from subcontractors where required. They are also considering building a dedicated software development team based in India to run alongside the Managed Services division. Plum Software mainly uses Python, Java and C++.

profileAbout.headline: Defense services
textItems: At Plum we work with a number of different clients in the provision of security and operational support. Whether you require ad hoc, single day consultancy, or a multiple year, multi-disciplined support team, our Subject Matter Experts (SME) have experience and knowledge of all aspects of supporting Defence capability on a diverse range of platforms, equipment, systems and services. In addition to supporting the MOD directly we also support the Defence industry. This includes Airworthiness, Engineering, Operational and Safety support for the delivery of systems and services to be deployed as a part of military capability. Threats to national security are constantly evolving, whether they’re military, cyber or terror. So organisations must evolve to meet them. We help government organisations and police forces reshape and reorganise to counter threats and keep people safe. And we help aerospace, defence and security businesses anticipate and meet their clients’ needs.

Our diverse teams of experts work with government agencies and private sector companies to make them more efficient so they can handle budget pressure, and more responsive so they can prepare for the future. We help our clients resolve strategic conundrums, like making sure the armed forces have enough people with the right skills and judging when to overhaul equipment and technology. We do it by taking the time to understand each challenge and opportunity instead offering an off-the-shelf solution. And we work with individuals, teams and entire workforces to ensure everyone is clear on their purpose and that culture change sticks. We combine unrivalled sector insight with specialist expertise drawn from different industries and geographies. This means the solutions we develop are both innovative and pragmatic.

Following nearly two decades of 'upstream' military intervention to contain threats such as terrorism and drugs production before they reached the UK's shores, recent experience has increased the focus on home-grown threats such as radicalisation, lone-actor terrorism and serious organised crime. This has raised awareness of the role of illicit finance as the universal enabler for terrorism, crime and many state-sponsored threats. And yet, the structure of the UK's security and policing sector is largely unreformed, numbering over 70 independent organisations, all pursuing broadly similar capabilities, and competing for the same scarce skills and talent, albeit to meet different mission priorities.
Government, the armed forces, and the defence industry face transformational challenges as they respond to the new dynamic trends of the 21st century:

bulletList.highlight: Changes in the nature of war:
bulletList.text: Governments and armed forces are being increasingly challenged to develop complex, pan-agency coalition responses under the full spotlight of 24/7 media coverage.

bulletList.highlight: Changes in the spectrum of conflict:
bulletList.text: These groups must intensify their focus on counterinsurgency missions, the protection of vulnerable communities, and the need to devise effective strategies to counter the proliferation of drugs, piracy, and weapons of mass destruction.
The defence industry must achieve information superiority and increase its speed of response, precision, and interoperability.

bulletList.highlight: Changes in the provision of capability:
bulletList.text: Continuous improvement, spiral development, and cradle-to-grave management require new acquisition models and partnered approaches.

profileAbout.headline: Managed services
textItems: Managed security service providers, also known as MSSPs, provide cybersecurity outsourcing options covering a range of security needs. These services may include patching and vulnerability management and reporting, threat intelligence, incident response, and other services. Additionally, MSSPs provide their own expertise and knowledge on emerging threats and security developments. Plum offers these services within their managed services division.

MSSPs can use either their own security technology or deliver 3rd party technology to their clients and end-users. The security software itself is managed remotely by the provider. Our outsourcing services reduces or eliminates the client business’s need for in-house hardware, IT resources, or knowledge experts. Managed security service providers also offer more specialised expertise than many smaller in-house operations would be able to source themselves.
Managed security service providers give clients the added benefit of various services around the core functionalities. These services and support areas include:

bulletList.highlight: Training and education, particularly training against people related threats such as phishing

textItems: Our services also encompass a wider range of IT functions and operations, including managing cloud infrastructure, cloud computing, and other resource or operationally-intensive functions. Our managed security service providers specialise in removing digital security burdens from their clients’ IT or operations teams. In order to focus on the unique expertise and resources required in digital security.

bulletList.highlight: Firewalls, including network or web application firewalls

profileAbout.headline: Systems Engineering and Integration
textItems: For over 20 years, Plum has helped clients achieve step-change improvements in their OT/ICS reliability and security. Everything we do is about bringing our expertise to help overcome the challenges of secure and reliable IT-OT systems. Plum systems engineering and integration offers the only Endpoint Protection Platform built for OT/ICS Cyber Security. We combine the platform with leading ICS/OT engineers who provide turnkey support every step of the way. We are your partner in your OT/ICS security journey.

Plum has the ability to sustain your operational efficiency and allow you to adjust to today’s economic pressures. With minimal resource usage, we provide cost effective solutions that are designed to work with your existing system, as well as, highly skilled technical engineers to support corporate networking infrastructure. With staff experienced in different Operating Systems and networking environments, Plum is the answer to any problem taking place within your network.

From the deployment of Exchange servers, to the enabling of remote access through VPN technologies, Plum can offer end to end solutions and support that fulfil your expectations whilst still fit your budget.
Our services include but are not limited to the following:

bulletList.text: TCP/IP Configuration - BIND service - DHCP service - SAMBA - Yellow Pages Service - NFS - NIS Service - Printing (IPP, LPQ) - Apache Server - VNC Server - Send mail Server
CIPE service (VPN Service for Linux) - IPSec Configuration - IPTables (Linux firewall) - PAM

Customizing and rebuilding kernels - File Systems configuration - Disaster Recovery and RAID - Scheduling and automating tasks - XServer configuration - Backup and Restoration - Clustering Support and maintenance

TCP/IP Configuration - Domain Name System (DNS) Service - Dynamic Host COnfiguration Protocol (DHCP) - Windows Internet Name Service (WINS) - Distributed File System (DFS) Service - Print Server - File Server
Virtual Private Networks - Network Address Translation - ISA Server 2003 - IPSec - Certificate Services

Disaster Recovery and RAID - Backup and Restoration - Local Security Policy configuration - Disk management - Boot Process troubleshooting - Performance monitoring and system tuning - Monitoring and Tuning - Local monitoring and tuning - Remote monitoring and tuning
Desktop Protection - Network Protection - Email Protection
Monitoring and Tuning - Monitoring the services performance - Tuning services and optimization

profileAbout.headline: Plum Software
textItems: Plum delivers end-to-end software products and solutions from concept to code and development to deployment. Our software development services include custom software & application development, cloud-based enterprise & web application development and connected mobile application development. With our experience in next-generation software solutions and services, we help drive digital transformation. We assist our clients in selecting the most competent and cost-effective platform to build their applications.

Plum Software mainly uses Python, Java and C++. We work with our customers as a partner, not just as suppliers, and underpin these values with outcomes-based contracting, to ensure that your goals are our goals. This aim of partnership means we work with you, rather than delivering to you, ensuring that we enable and empower your organization throughout our engagement.
Plum support these development services with cross-functional skilled teams, with blended and onshore delivery models available, helping to ensure consistent business continuity.

All of Plum’s services are supported by a commitment to creating trust, via high quality services, but also via the stringent security and compliance standards to which we hold ourselves. By choosing to develop using our Services from Plum, you’ll be working with a partner who can help you solve your business problem holistically, rather than piece by piece.

bulletList.text: Our software design team of skilled and enthusiastic experts, which is steadily growing. We carefully select each candidate based on their skills, qualifications, and experience.

bulletList.highlight: Vast experience in the IT industry.
bulletList.text: We have been one of the pioneers of software development, starting at the dawn of smartphone era, and over the years have worked with many internationally renowned brands and utilised top-notch technologies for software creation.

Our experienced developers have delivered hundreds of successful projects for organisations from all around the world across different industries including healthcare, travel, manufacturing, transport, education and others.

jobsBoard.title: Security Analyst
jobsBoard.description: PLUM Limited are hiring a Security Analyst

callsToAction.text: click here to find out more

paragraphs: Plum Ltd. is a provider of cyber technology software development and consulting services based in the UK. Plum Ltd.was formed in 1995 and is a specialist provider of technology products and services to the defense sector and has grown over the years branching into multiple markets.
Plum Ltd.has 10,000 employees based in the UK but is looking for offices in other locations in the US and Australia to offer a 24 hour a day service to its customers.

Defence organisations- Plum Ltd. has significant contracts for supporting core IT,communication and operational systems of the UK MoD, US DoD and NATO. Plum Ltd. are often engaged on projects involving SECRET and TOP SECRET information assets and systems.

Central Government organisations - Plum Ltd. have been engaged in major government system integrations, developing specific software solutions alongside providing managed services such as Security Operation Centre (SOC) services and defensive and offensive security capabilities.

Industrial organisations. Given Plum Ltd.specialist engineering background they have deep expertise in Industrial Control Systems (ICS) and provide managed security services to major clients in sectors such as Oil and Gas, Water management and electricity distribution.
Financial institutions. Plum Ltd.have provided specialist security services, including threat and intelligence monitoring to global financial institutions.

sections.header: Key Responsibilities of the Security Analyst
bulletSection: Carrying out audits to ensure that compliance with security standards such as ISO27001 are met
Use SIEM technology to monitor networks for security alerts
Analyse threats, breaches and vulnerabilities such as malware
Carrying out vulnerability scans and organising Penetration Tests with 3rd party suppliers
Working with external security professionals and business stakeholders to simulate security breaches and document incident response plans as required
Monitoring identify and access management, including monitoring for abuse of permissions by authorised system users
Researching/evaluating emerging cyber security threats and ways to manage them
Liaising with stakeholders in relation to cyber security issues and provide future recommendations
Generating reports for both technical and non-technical staff and stakeholders
Maintaining the information security risk register and assist with internal and external audits relating to information security
Assisting with the creation, maintenance and delivery of cyber security awareness training

sections.header: This is an entry level position with no experience required, however the ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate the following:
bulletSection: A basic understanding of Information Security
Desire to enhance knowledge and develop further skills within the field by dedicated self-study
A basic understanding of risk management and control frameworks
A basic understanding of SIEM Technology / Penetration Testing and Network Security
Someone who is up to date with security news and the current threat landscape
Excellent team player
Prioritisation and organisational skills
Clear dn transparent communication
Critical Thinking and Problem Solving
Decision Making
Adaptability, Presntable, professional and punctual
